inn1.comm: hint of movement first up, back of a length at off stump, straightens a touch on Roy who defends with a slightly open face to backward point
pushed down the leg side and that gets England underway
edged! But wide of second slip. Full at off stump, Roy driving forcefully, the bat slices across the line a touch, and the ball flies down to third man
full and straight, clipped sweetly to square leg
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers
gets a little too straight this time, angles into the pads, Hales flicks it wide of mid-on and the ball runs quickly over the outfield but Tahir just manages to haul it back
an extravagant flick from Roy this time, on leg stump again, sends it quickly to long leg
no holding back from Roy (shall we have a look, lads?) as he drives a full delivery on the up over the off side, doesn't quite time it perfectly
back of a length, angled into Roy, takes him high above the pads
gets him chasing this full delivery outside off, swinging away, beats the edge as Roy drives away from his body
gets forward and across onto off stump, defended towards mid-on
full outside off, this time he leaves it alone
back of a length outside off, shaping away from Roy who defends behind point where it squeezes away for a single
gets his line full outside off, Roy opens the face and guides down to third man
back of a length outside off, 136kph, punched into the covers
waits on the back foot and drives into the covers
that's a confident stroke, comes forward and drives square on the up but it goes straight to du Plessis at point
full, at the stumps, Hales coming forward and clips firmly to mid-on
good line, much better second over, back of a length tight at off stump, no width for Hales to work with and he defends back to the bowler
plenty of action! A sweetly-struck drive towards mid-off and he sets off for the run. It's de Villiers at mid-off with the pick-up and throw. A direct hit would have been very tight
played into the covers
nearly bunts this to cover, a full delivery, Hales pushing with hard hands. The ball may have stopped a fraction. Falls just short.
driven firmly from off stump to mid-on
angled into the pads, takes the thigh guard towards long leg
good delivery, on middle and off, Roy has to jab down smartly as he defends
full at the stumps, driven to mid-off
stands on leg stump and clubs a full delivery down to long on
the googly, tucked through the leg side
quicker, flatter, delivery and Hales is on the back foot as he drives down the ground
well bowled, this skids on again, almost defeats Roy who is playing off the back foot, takes a bottom edge wide of the stumps

he's done it! A beauty from Tahir and he's got Roy lbw. A touch of gold from de Villiers and Tahir. This one gripped a spun. Pitched around middle and leg, spun to beat the outside edge, struck him on the back leg. Roy debated with Hales about a review - for height - but then slowly makes his way off
starts full on the pads and Hales breaks free with a strong flick in front of square leg
another tight run! Hales drives firmly towards mid-off, just to de Villiers' left, he gets a nice bounce but then misses with a stump-and-a-half to aim at
angled into the pads again and that's a nice start for Root as he whips it through square leg
he's some trouble this time, a short ball at 143kph, Root in two minds whether to hook or pull out, ends up taking the top edge and looping over the slips
short again, slipping down the leg side, Root glances at it and sends it just out of reach of a flying de Kock
that's lively! A short delivery on off stump, good line, climbs awkwardly at Root who fends it away in front of his face. A all-sorts of an over from Morris.
starts with a poor delivery, slips into the pads, flicked fine to beat long leg

he adjusts his line to outside off, driven square through the covers, beats point and skids over the outfield...Rossouw manages to reach it, but then slips on the greasy outfield and ends up touching the boundary rope
short of a length outside off, driven to point
full, shapes into the pads, flicked to midwicket
full and straight, 138kph, punched firmly to mid-on
streaky! Drives at a full ball outside off and it takes a thick inside edge past the stumps down to long leg
full at the stumps, worked to mid-on
just wide of leg gully! Almost another piece of captaincy that works as Root flicks this off his hip, doesn't keep it down, but it's just out of reach of the man at 45 degrees
defends a full, straight delivery
that's short, and sharp at 142kph, but slips down the leg side as Root gets his bat and gloves out of the line and it's called wdie

dropped! Amla at slip! This seemed to happen to slow-motion. Morris goes full outside off, tempts the drive from Root, it carries at around knee-height, a nice catching height, but it bursts through Amla's hands and he can barely believe it

What's happened here?! Hales has been given caught behind but he reviews immediately. No appeal at all from the bowler, but some from behind the bat. Driving at a full ball. Has he hit the ground? Yes, he has. He's miles away from the ball. This will be overturned...and is
short outside off, gets onto his toes, over the top of the ball and cuts down to third mabn
another edge, Hales pushing at a full delivery around off stump, but it goes wide of second slip to third man
gets across onto off stump, defends
flicked off his hip to square leg
short of a length outside off, tries to upper cut and gets beaten over the top edge
full at middle and off, driven to mid-on
short ball, and that's a superbly controlled pull from Root as he rolls his wrists and gets over the top of the ball to beat long leg
short and wide outside off, cut firmly to point
a strangled appeal for lbw as this is full and Hales misses his flick across the line but the ball is angled down the leg side
that's a beauty...and it costs four! A terrific yorker, either by accident or design, and almost gets through to take leg stump but the toe end of Hales' bat just deflects it past the keeper
short, shoved down the leg side, another wide...South Africa have been all over the place since that wicket. Some good deliveries, but some poor stuff as well
back outside off stump and that's a delightful stroke, perhaps the best of the day, as he comes forward and drives on the up through the covers
full at the stumps, drilled to mid-on
that's a good delivery, tight on off stump, defended with bat and pad together
starts straight and gets flicked through midwicket, deep square gets around the boundary
back of a length outside off, defended to cover
another crisp pull from Root, gets over the ball and finds deep square leg
back of a length outside off, driven square to point
short, over off stump, Hales sways out of the line as the ball follows him
back of a length, dragged through the leg side out to deep midwicket
full at the stumps, eased down the ground
outside off, plays with the turn into the off side
driven to the on side, Tahir dives across
goes onto the back foot, that can be risky to Tahir when he slides one on, tucked into the leg side to bring up the fifty stand
driven to the covers
cuts a length delivery off the stumps and it beats point to allow a brace
full at off stump, driven to mid-on
dabbed behind square on the off side and that's good rotation of the strike
full outside off, opens the face and finds backward point
short and he pulls it to deep square

top edge, but doesn't quite reach Tahir at long leg! Another short ball, this time Root can't controlled his pull, takes a top edge, Tahir commits to trying for the catch but it falls short and he can't stop the ball either
that's a ugly heave...down the pitch and tries to smite this across the line through midwicket. Not sure any need for that
comes forward and drives to long off
on the back foot, might have been the googly, flicked off the pads to deep square
driven firmly to cover, short and Hales will feel he missed out
uses his feet, the ball is outside leg stump, flicked along the ground through midwicket

huge appeal for lbw, and given after the review! Given not out first of all as Root misses his sweep, Tahir is desperate for the review, he was calling for it in his follow through! Tahir is convinced. Don't think there's any bat. No edge showing up. This is pretty straight by the looks of it. He's got a good stride in, but that doesn't mean much these days. Three reds! And he's gone. Tahir was right.
defended into the leg side
a bouncer, Hales ducks
short again, not a full-on bouncer this time, over off stump and Hales drops his gloves
he's in some pain this time. Short again, Hales goes for the pull and gets a bottom edge into his ribcage
slips in a low full toss, slides off a thick outside edge down to third man
full outside off, angled across the left hander, left alone...a slip in place
left alone again to end the over
a firm drive down to long on
touch shorter outside off, Morgan dabs to short third man
pushed across Morgan who brings out the reverse sweep but doesn't make contact
defended from off stump into midwicket
comes down the pitch, Tahir drags the length a fraction shorter, Morgan defends
tucked from outside off into midwicket and he's off the mark from his eighth delivery
back of a length on the hips and Morgan tucks it away through backward square for a single
full and swinging late, decent yorker from Wiese but Hales gets his bat down just in time, and a thick outside edge squirts past slip and runs all the way for four, fine of third man, to boot
good length around off stump, on to the front dog and blocks
length ball on the stumps, nudged through backward square

Morgan skips out, Wiese spears it across... and flicks the top edge through to de Kock! England's captain goes, a disappointing series for him, he was again trying to stamp his mark on proceedings but ended up chasing a wide one
back of a length and blocked on the back foot
length ball, Hales cross bats it back towards the bowler
dragged down through the leg side for a couple
tossed up and punched into the covers coming forwards
gives it some air, Hales comes forward and drives one through mid-off
stays over the wicket to the southpaw Stokes, googly pushed across, left alone
tight lines, legbreak on middle and off and Stokes defends it respectfully

back of a length, bat scissoring down down late... and inside edged over/past leg stump for four! Not where he was intending it to go but that boundary takes Hales to fifty for the fifth time in a row
length ball on off stump, Hales defends this time
back of a length at the body, Hales tucks a single through backward square leg
angled across the left-hander, left alone
comes forward to defend to the on side
fullish, comes on to the front foot to drive through the covers for a couple
short and wide from Tahir and Hales doolally taps it through backward point for four
drops a little short and Hales whips it through the leg side
goes round the wicket, angled in and ghosts past the outside edge, Stokes playing the wrong line
full outside off, possibly the googly, Stokes squeezes it out on the drive for a couple
tossed up and steered to the cover sweeper
leans into a forward defensive
Wiese is getting a little nibble from the surface here, draws the drive and Stokes thick edges down to third man
good length on off stump, prodded into the covers
slightly short and Hales turns to leg from in front of the stumps
worked off the hips, wide of the man at fine leg for a couple
banged in short and Hales clouts a pull to deep square for one
sliding across in the channel of botheration and Stokes feels for it unsuccessfully
comes across and steers a shortish ball through point
Stokes shuffles into line and clips a short delivery through square leg
back of a length, going on with the arm, Hales tucks another single to leg
angled across the bows, Stokes keeps his powder dry
banged in short, swivels on a pull through square leg, mostly bottom edge
down the leg side, brushes the pads... and runs away for extras
on the stumps, Stokes heaves at it and gets a couple through midwicket off the inside half of the bat
overpitched and Stokes leans into a crunchy-looking drive, Rabada is foxed by a bobble at mid-off and it gets away from him
gets across on off stump to defend
short and there's width on offer for Hales to swing his stick of rhubarb through a late cut, beats third man to the punch right on the rope
gets into line and punches to cover off the back foot
back of a lenght outside off and Hales swats another down to third man
plugging away on fourth stumps, Hales drops into line and defends
fullish and pushed into the covers coming forwards
too full from Morris and Hales taxes it for four, beating the dive of Rabada running round at deep extra cover... Cross-seam delivery and it got the full face of the bat
loses his radar again, on the pads, flicked for one
back of a length, Stokes jumps into line and dabs down into the covers
short and wide this time, cracked through point off the back foot
on the stumps, worked back on the leg side
full length, Stokes gets forward and drives fine of mid-off for a quick single
good length on the stumps and Hales tucks one through the leg side to bring up the 50 stand between these two
shortish, drops back and steers towards point
pushed across the left-hander, Stokes goes back and runs one to third man
full on off stump, Hales blocks it down towards his toes
pitched up and stroked through the covers coming forwards
full length, taking the pace off, Hales pushes through the covers
lets this one go in the channel
crunched! Slightly full, another slower ball and Stokes batters the rapscallion back through mid-on
short and at the body in response, nudged firmly off the hips through square
banged in short, Hales swings with great vengeance and furious anger on his mind... loops on the bounce to deep square leg
tossed up on the stumps, punched down the ground
leans into a forward defensive
pushed through pretty quickly, Stokes works it to the man at midwicket
uses the feet, gets out and drills through the mid-off
flat on the stumps, Hales nurdles to leg
if it's up, it's off! Stokes just clears the leaping Rossouw on the deep midwicket boundary! A mighty heave, he does like the bare-knuckle bludgeon to leg and he got enough on it this time
punched into the ground, Rabada gets a hand on it and deflects to mid-off... They thought about trying to pinch one but eventually played it safe
banged in very short... to high
back of a length on off stump, defended from the crease
short again, at the body and Hales whirls his hands through a pull square
pushed across on a good length, Stokes doesn't take the bait

bowled 'im, behind the legs! Rabada roars, Stokes throws back his head in disgust... He was moving across and looking to flick off his pads, maybe beaten for pace and he'd certainly lost his bearings as the ball removed the leg bail
fired down the leg side as Buttler moves across and misses with a glance

straight through him, stumps on the ground! What a sight that is... Buttler gets his second duck in three innings - a second first-baller, in fact, since the previous delivery was a wide - and England's position slips from promising to precarious. Wonderful delivery from Rabada, although there was a big gap for the ball to veer back through, clipped the inside edge and then uprooted leg stump. Pow!
tossed up and flicked to midwicket from the crease
pushed through, sliding on with the arm, Hales clips one through backward square
bit of width, possibly a googly from Tahir and Moeen frees his arms to spank his first ball through backward point for four
floated up and strokes through the covers for one
Hales shuffles across and works one back down the ground
Tahir drops short again, Moeen rocks back to cut but finds backward point this time
length ball in the channel, Hales steers it to backward point
over the top of off stump, defended down into the turf
slightly wide and Hales plays with with wristy perfection, sliding a drive toward third man, using the pace and it's too quick for the fielder, who palms it along the rope for four
angled in on the stumps, nudged through backward square leg
Moeen waits in the crease and tucks another single off his pads
short of a length, Hales plays across the line and is hit on the thigh pad
bit of extra lift from a length as Moeen stays back and rides the bounce towards point
short delivery, rocks into position and swats a pull through backward square
touch short, around off stump, Hales continues to play judiciously, tapping the ball down square
dug in short, 135kph and Hales... fluffs a top-edged pull out towards deep square leg! Lands a yard short of Morris as he comes diving in off the fence!
full on off stump and Moeen strokes his beard one down the ground
slightly full, Hales blocks on off stump
yowzer, nearly got him! Rising in the channel through to de Kock as Moeen has his contractual lazy waft outside off
tight lines, this time Moeen gets behind it
banged in short, climbing over the batsman - and called on height
feisty little yorker from Rabada, right on the money but Moeen is equal to it
flashed in the air over point! Full length, Moeen got forward and threw his magical wrists through a square drive, pretty safe on this occasion
goes across his stumps to defend
angling in with the arm, Hales watches it under his eyeline and nurdles square
short of a length, angled into the hip, tucked to long leg
full at off stump, defended to cover
a lovely-looking drive from Moeen, onto the front foot but picks out mid-off
worked off the pads into square leg
full outside off, pushed square into point
opens the face and guides down to third man to end the over
tight on middle and off, pushed firmly into the covers
pushed down the ground
round the wicket, speared in full at the stumps, neatly clipped through the leg side and finds the gap
back of a length outside off, played back to the bowler

terrific catch at cover! And England sink further. Full outside off, Moeen always keen to have a drive, his weight is leaning a touch backwards, he spoons it in the air and Behardien gets good hang-time at cover to grab it one-handed above his head
nice delivery, back of a length outside off, nibbles away from Woakes who just his bat out of the line
pushed down the leg side
flicked off the pads to deep square leg
nicely bowled, nipped back off a length, cramps him for room as defends
beats the outside edge with a full delivery which straightens to defeat Woakes' prod
comes forward into a pleasing drive which finds mid-off

would you believe it! It's a poor ball, full on leg stump, and Woakes just clips it straight to the man at long leg. He didn't have to move. Wiese is almost embarrassed that the ball took a wicket, but he won't mind in the slightest
he ducks a bouncer to end the over...Hales quickly running out of partners
low full toss, driven to cover
full on middle and off, gets forward and defends
outside off, opens the face and finds third man
driven to mid-off
good stuff from Abbott, wicket-to-wicket, and Hales pushes to mid-on who is inside the circle
width outside off but he can only slash it straight to point
neatly played, shows Woakes what he should have done, flicks a ball from leg stump off his pads - along the ground to fine leg
tight leave! This nips back off the seam and is close to shaving off stump as Rashid shoulders arms
and this one shapes away the other direction, very nice bowling, and Rashid is a little uncertain as he tries to leave
goes full again, but slips into the pads...he strangles an lbw appeal as the ball glances away to fine leg. Did Rashid get a tickle? Looks like boot to me, but given runs
another giveaway from England! Pretty dim batting from Rashid, he had picked up two boundaries in the over but decided to try and clear mid-off with a drive and just picked out the man
pulls the bat inside the line as this one slides across outside off
short and pulled to deep square so he loses the strike at the start of the over
in the channel outside off, think Broad may have played at that
pitches outside leg stump so makes the appeal null and void, takes the pad into the leg side
full and straight, driven sweetly through mid-on and with the aid of a misfield he gets a boundary which takes him i 98. De Villiers the man unable to flick it back
full, swinging into the toes, takes the pad to fine leg
back of a length, takes a thick outside edge to backward point
push-and-run to mid-on, onto 99
nicely played, flicked away from middle and leg through midwicket
driven off the back foot to deep cover
pushed down the leg side, Hales misses his tickle...didn't nick this one
tries to work this into the leg side but misses and gets taken on the pads
not yet! Full and straight, driven firmly into midwicket...too much power
can't find space in the off side this time as he pushes square to point
pushed into the on side
down the leg side, another extra to the tally
full at leg stump, flicked into midwicket and Hales has the strike again

there it is! A super stroke to bring it up, a sweet on-drive that beats the man inside the circle. The helmet comes off and he takes in the applause. But it's a rather muted celebration. He knows England are in trouble
that's more of a heave and he picks out mid-on
short, down the leg side, Hales pulls...was there an edge? De Kock diving to his right. Given a leg-bye. How does that work? Pretty sure he gloved that
full and down the leg side, another wide...that won't impress de Villiers
full and straight, defended
worked into the leg side
tries to force this way from off stump, gets a thick inside edge back to the bowler
well-directed short ball, Broad takes his eye off it as he pulls but manages to find long leg
defended into the off side
gets over the top of a short ball and pulls into square leg
beaten by a full delivery, going for a flat-footed drive and it scoots past the inside edge
full outside off, Hales chases it with a drive and doesn't make contact
finds the ball on the bat this time, a flowing drive to the cover sweeper
well bowled! Good short ball, Broad fends at it, turning his head away from the ball, but it pops into space on the off side
what happened here? Broad is beaten by a short-of-a-length delivery which keeps quite low
full at leg stump, clipped through square leg
worked off the stumps into the leg side so he keeps the strike
low full toss, Hales sweeps powerfully and finds the gap at deep square leg
tries a repeat, but this time the ball pitches and he's beaten by the turn and bounce
down the pitch, ends up yorking himself, bunted down the ground
this slides past the outside edge as Broad prods forward
goes down early for a paddle-sweep, the ball was well outside off stump, takes the pad into the off side...an optimistic shout from Tahir
just short! Tahir came round the wicket, was a little shorter, Broad went for the pull and it didn't quite reach de Villiers at midwicket
picks out the man! Tries to clear deep square leg with a pull, he connected cleanly but could not quite get the required distance and it's a well-taken catch on the boundary
back of a length, defended to midwicket
goes for the fuller ball, swings into Topley and takes the pad but angling down the leg side
gets behind the line of a short-of-a-length delivery
half an appeal for lbw as this swings into the pads again
good leave? Well, he survives. On length as much as line from Topley. Think that carried over off stump. A wicket maiden.
that's big! Broad has planted Tahir into the crowd over deep midwicket. Might clean swing of the bat
quicker, pushed up fuller, played back to the bowler
goes for a lofted drive, sliced in the air down to long off
bonus runs for England! Almost cleaned up by the googly, beaten all ends up, bounces over the stumps and de Kock can't gather it
pushed into the leg side, they take the single
pushed across wide outside off, Broad has a big heave and it's called wide
and that's all over, Broad tries to clear the off side but can't get it any further than cover. Broad's view was to get what he could. Not his fault England were in a mess.

inn2.comm: round the wicket, on off stump and pushed back down the ground
length outside the line of off, de Kock reaches for a drive into the covers
full and drive, uppish and Broad bellows "catch!" Morgan is going to his right at mid-off and it doesn't carry
sliding in with the arm, defended off the inside half of the bat towards mid-on
fullish length outside off, de Kock pushes into the covers, not timed again
driven on the up backward towards mid-on - Broad proving difficult to get away and that's a maiden
length on middle and off, shaping in as Amla brings his bat down at an angle, gets away with a low edge through gully
tantalising from Toppers, boinging away off a length outside off and de Kock nearly hangs himself out to dry
boshed! Really gets hold of this one in response, lacerated past mid-off on the drive, Morgan's dived by it flashed by him in a blink
beaten again, trying to drive! Bit of nibble back in and past the inside edge
good length, shuffles forward and plays into the ground off the bottom half of the bat
length delivery, fourth stump and defended down, rolls back and de Kock is there to shoo it away from his stumps... Playing with a slightly close face, which could get him in trouble
line and length in the corridor outside off, Amla watches it impassively
slightly shorter, moves across to block on off stump
excellent line from Broad, neither-nor length and Amla seems in two minds about leaving
shorter, angling back in, pulled safely down through backward square leg for one
back round the wicket, pitched up and de Kock drives, the bat turns in the hands and sends it to midwicket
good length outside off, de Kock steers it square from the crease
slightly short and veering down the leg side as Amla swishes and misses
fullish length on the stumps, 128kph and jabbed away
pitched up around off stump, opens the face and steers towards point
fired down the leg side again - costly extras for England
little bit of shape back in towards the right-hander from over the wicket, inside-edged through square leg
back of a length, tapped down square on the off side
loses his line down the leg side, possibly a slower ball... definitely a wide
good length, 132kph on the stumps, keeps de Kock honest
better from Topley, no room for de Kock to swing his arms, prodded to mid-on
length ball, slightly wide of the stumps but Amla isn't playing at those (yet)
tighter to off, 136kph and blocked from the crease
lovely stroke, back-foot punch from Amla, just offered a bit of width and he caressed it with Fairy soft hands to the point boundary
back to line and length in the channel, left alone
pressed forward and defends, Broad fields... and does a bit of keepy-uppy, for kicks
shorter, worked off the body square

nips it through him, big, big appeal from Topley - and England are going to review the not-out decision. It was a good, searching ball, over the top of off but did it clip the inside edge on its way through? Yes, it did! Visible edge on to his trouser pocket, which might have been the bit that threw Chris Gaffaney, but it won't cost England, as the decision is overturned and the finger is raised! Top stops de Kock

big inswinger to start with - he's got him first ball! Loose drive from du Plessis, flicks the inside edge and rattles leg stump... Topley is on a hat-trick! Not sure about the stroke but it has certainly shaken this chase up
length ball on the stumps, calmly defended by the new batsman
gets into line and dabs down into the off side
touch shorter, going on with the arm, Rossouw shows it a solid straight bat
gets some away movement and Rossouw thinks twice about following it - good over from Topley
Amla gets across and defends, attempting to settle things
good length, presses forward and blocks solidly
short ball, Amla latches on to it and whistles a pull away through square leg for four
lets this one go outside off
shortish around off stump, Amla shows it a solid straight bat
jumps into line to defend again
super shot from Rossouw! Touch too full and straight and he threads a drive back whence it came
dug in short, goes for the full and gets a bottom edge

pitched up and he goes for the drive... but plinks it to extra cover! Topley has a third, Rossouw leans over his bat aghast. Maybe stopped in the pitch and he didn't connect properly, just presented a Valentine's gift to Hales standing close in
gets on to the front foot to block
big lbw appeal, the ball curling back in menacingly - saved by an inside edge! That looked done all ends up on first sight but de Villiers knew he'd got something on it
length delivery, no swing this time, 128kph on off stump and blocked
Broad continues to tie Amla down outside off, left alone in the channel
plugging away in the channel, no stroke
tighter to the stumps, Amla jumps into line and defends
tight lines, again Amla shows it a straight bat, just looking to steady things
fuller, tempts the drive, short extra cover half-stops it but they pinch one to mid-off
back of a lentgh outside off, opens the face and dabs to third man
good length, de Villiers comes forward to drive, hits the inside half of the bat and bounces back to the bowler
pushed across back of a length, dabbed down on the off side
slightly short and de Villiers again drops back, can't get it past backward point
crashed through midwicket, such fast hands from de Villiers, brings him his first boundary... Just a step out and whip of the wrists
now Topley strays on to the pads, only a touch required to send it to the fence
gets it on target, de Villiers respectfully defends from the crease
goes full on off stump to begin with, decent yorker and Amla hastily drops his bat on it
length ball on the stumps, worked with the bottom hand to mid-on
slightly too straight, flicked through midwicket
length around off stump, de Villiers plays with an open face and runs one to third man
full and shaping in a fraction on off stump, punched whippily to mid-off
Amla hopes back and across and nurdles one more to leg
pitched up and steered through the covers coming forwards... Ah, and Stokes had overstepped
de Villiers snatches up a fistful of candy! Length ball, he picks it and swings a lusty blow high over deep midwicket for the first six of the innings
back of a length, gets across and taps down square for one
very full outside off, Amla jams his bat down on it and squeezes another single to third man
137kph in the channel, good length and left alone
touch fuller, driven viciously on the up and Stokes stops it in his follow through... In fact, it bounced, er, unfortunately, and struck him a glancing blow in the spuds. Oof
ripping delivery! Just outside off and it takes off, searing past the outside edge as de Villiers prods from the crease
full outside off and Amla tries to launch into it, mishits a drive to mid-off
length on the stumps, Amla waits for it and tucks one round the corner
touch short, de Villiers hops back on leg stump and clips square
slightly full on off stump, stroked along the ground to mid-off
Woakes goes short and Amla socks it to him, roundhouse pull through backward square, between two men for four
good length, Amla pushes forward on off, gets an inside edge to leg
full toss, Amla toes at back to the bowler... did Stokes drop that? No, didn't quite carry

Amla doesn't know where this has gone, it drops down behind him and de Villiers calls them through... Stokes tries some fancy footwork, a sort of Cruyff backheel - and nearly breaks his ankle stepping on the ball
full length and lashed through the covers! Rocket Man hits the ignition, blasting four off the front foot
leaves this one along in the channel
full and sprayed wide of the tramlines, menaced only by a de Villiers' glance this time
drops back and steers one through point
on the stumps, worked into the leg side
pitched up on off stump and driven to mid-off
drops back and runs the ball towards wide slip/gully
short and wide and cracked off the back foot through point, there's a man out there
angled in with the arm, de Villiers nudges one through midwicket
on the stumps and worked to leg agian
good length outside off, de Villiers jumps across and pads up - hit the knee roll but well outside off and not coming back
shortish, mishit back down the track and Rashid fields
tossed up, comes forward and pushes into the covers
leans over a forward defence
nicely flighted, around off stump and Amla again picks out a fielder on the drive
floated up a little straighter and Amla finally works a single away to midwicket
flat legbreak outside off, tapped in front of square - decent start from Rashid
back of a length, finds a leading edge as Amla shapes to play to the leg side but the ball ends up safely at third man
gets across his crease and defends quite a wide delivery towards the lone slip
width offered and that's hammered in front of square through the covers, Moeen does very well as the sweeper to get around and prevent the boundary
this time he's drilled it wide of the sweeper, very full and de Villiers was quickly forward and punched it with considerable power through the covers
drags the length back, finds the inside edge which cannons into the pads
width again, more work for Moeen as he scampers towards deep point to cut this off...brings up the fifty stand between two fulcrums of South Africa's one-day side
dabbed square into the off side
full and straight, driven to deep cover
touch more air this time, driven down the ground to long-off
shorter delivery, rocks onto the back foot and slices out to deep cover
the googly, outside off, the bat twists in his hand and the ball runs to midwicket
a whirlwind drive through the covers, wide of the sweeper again, he's going very nicely
full outside off, driven on the up square through the off side
full outside off, defended into the point area
full at off stump, driven firmly back to Stokes
that's a poor delivery, full and floaty outside off, de Villiers dispatches it through the off side with another rasping drive (although floaty half volleys aren't much good in any format)
hammered again! Full and wide, de Villiers throws his hands through another stinging drive and there is no stopping it
pulls the length back, at off stump, defended but plenty of damage done in that over
played back to the bowler
tossed up, low full toss, and that's effortlessly driven through the covers, placed between long-off and deep cover
now he's back and cuts a shorter delivery to deep point
the googly, full outside off, defended
straighter delivery, eased down the ground to long on
presses forward, might have been another wrong 'un, takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
full outside off, left alone
he's going to take on Broad again, charges down the pitch and swats a short-of-a-length delivery to deep square. Hold on, folks
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point
dabbed square into the off side
he's charging Broad again, it's a shorter delivery, he goes for the pull but is through his shot and taken on the forearm...that will bruise
back of a length outside off, fiddled behind point
poor ball, pushed down the leg side, de Villiers doesn't make contact and Buttler can't stop it either
clubbed down the ground to long off
tossed up very full, driven into the covers where Roy makes a good save
doesn't get this quite right, his eyes lit up at a short delivery, he tried to clear the leg side, but it went almost straight up only to fall into space in the midwicket area
jabs at a quicker ball outside off
flicks a straight delivery off the stumps backward of square
fetched from outside off and whipped down to long on
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man to take him to an excellent 46-ball fifty...good way to mark his 200th ODI
opens the face and calmly works a length ball to third man
short outside off, played to deep cover
short of a length, Amla gets behind the line and defends to the leg side
rolls his wrists on a pull to long leg
easily worked down to third man to keep the strike
padded away outside off
driven down to long on
touch short, whipped off the back foot but picks out square leg
flicked into midwicket
wonderful improvisation from Amla as he steps across the crease and flicks this almost over his shoulder to fine leg
aiming a strong whip to the leg side, takes a leading edge towards point but along the ground
whips a straight delivery behind square on the leg side, Root flicks himself to his right
wide delivery but he can't take advantage as he cuts to backward point
full outside off, quite wide, left alone
hanging it wide outside off, and this one is too wide...Broad not happy
nearly finds the edge! Draws him away from his body, the ball just straightens a fraction and Amla is beaten
gets inside the line and tucks it off the hip to fine leg
that's a super stroke, latches onto a short ball and pulls it firmly through square leg... splits the gap perfectly
flicked along the ground to midwicket
low full toss worked back down the pitch
picks out midwicket again
driven into the off side
fraction short, rocks back and drives to cover
ends a tight over as he finds midwicket again, but there's no run-rate pressure on South Africa
dabbed to backward point
short and wide, this dies under Amla's bat as he tries to cut
full outside off, driven to deep cover
lovely timing and placement, gets across the crease and flicks a low full toss wide of mid-on...races away as Woakes makes a despairing dive near the rope
back of a length outside off, shovelled into the leg side
drives at a full delivery outside off and it squeezes into midwicket
flicked from off stump out to deep midwicket
low full toss his eased down the ground
turn here, nearly defeats Amla as he comes down the pitch but he's able to deflect it to short fine leg to bring up his fifty...just the innings South Africa needed
takes this from well outside off, along the ground to deep midwicket
into midwicket
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length, pushed into the backward point area
uses the angle coming into him, nudged to the leg side
using his crease, he's miles outside off when he whips this through the leg side and it's excellently placed out to deep midwicket
drives firmly behind square, a wider delivery pushed across Amla from over the wicket, and beats a diving backward point
dabbed down to third man
worked down the ground to long on
picked off through the leg side to deep midwicket
gets his front foot well outside off and nudges behind square on the leg side
hops back to a shorter delivery and pushes to long on
breakthrough! Is there still time for England? Amla comes down the pitch, the ball drifts away outside off and beats the drive, Buttler gathers and manages to get the ball back to the stumps
full, dug out towards mid-on
starts with a full toss which is driven to the cover sweeper
touch short, he waits for it to turn a little and places into the off side which allows him off strike
nicely bowled, a leg-break which grips a touch and takes an outside edge to short third man...played with soft hands
throws his full weight behind this drive and picks out the sweeper
fuller, but too wide and he's again driven to the sweeper
short again, but this time he picks out cover as he drives off the back foot
pushed into the off side
driven into the covers, a diving save keeps him on strike
push-and-run towards mid-off, smart batting
defended on the back foot back to the bowler
pushes this fuller delivery down to long on
tucked into leg side and a misfield at midwicket allows them back for a second
full at the stumps, driven to long offf
and he's in action this ball at backward point
worked away from leg stump, almost a mix-up in the running! De Villiers nearly slipped as he turned to get back
on the back foot, played to mid-on
driven past one of the two catching covers and to the left of mid-off
nicely bowled, full at off stump, tapped into the off side
floated up and smacked straight back down the ground for six! No mucking about from Behardien, collared Moeen and gave it a right wallop with no one out there to protect the boundary
drags this shorter and Behardien jabs a pull through midwicket
flighted, comes forward and punches one down the ground
pushed through, drops back and runs towards short third man
tossed up outside off, goes to drive and it grips, turns, hits the inside edge, running to mid-on
pushed back to the bowler
tossed up, driven back down the ground
reaches for the drive, played back to the bowler

tossed up above the eyeline, Behardien lured into the big shot but he hits it straight to mid-on! Credit to Morgan (wink, nudge) for keeping the man up on the edge of the ring, Rashid got the ball to dip on Behardien and he couldn't have picked him out better
floated up very full, driven to short extra cover
too full but Wiese miscues a bunt to mid-off
thrashed through the covers! Cries of catch but it went like a scud missile between the two catchers,
tossed up and driven back to the bowler, catches the bump ball
ooh er, this wasn't very good, de Villiers defeated in the flight and then finding a fielder - but Stokes' shy from the covers gifts them overthrows
angled in, punched down the ground
comes forward to push into the off side
bit too much width on this one and Wise swings those lumberjack forearms through a crunching drive backward of square
beats the outside edge! Nicely bowled, going on with the arm - although Buttler didn't catch it
flighted, comes forward on off stump and taps it away
straightening to hit the pads, half an appeal for lbw but that was heading down leg
gets on to the front foot and punches to cover
too full and AB cracks another rocket through the covers, right to the pitch and laser-guided to the boundary
nearly gets him stumped off a wide! Tossed up and spinning away as de Villiers lunged for the drive again
pushed back down the ground coming forwards
pushed through flatter and Wiese taps it away
flighted, on the stumps, played with the turn
shuffles forward and drives one to long-on
prods at a length ball, stiff wrists but the ball falls safely to the leg side
popped back down the track, short of the bowler
pushed through outside off and Wiese is able to Popeye the ball mercilessly through backward point for four more
tapped back down the track
floated up and de Villiers comes out to clip one more down the ground
pushed into the covers
tossed up and launched over long-on! There's nothing too complicated about Wiese's batting but he knows how to hit it hard

goes again, this one's even bigger... Murderous stuff from Wise, who's follows handsomely through the line and dumps Rashid into the crowd this time. SA bring up the 200 and that might well settle the matter
pushed through on the stumps, defended
slifghtly short and wide, punched through the covers on the back foot for a couple more
short of a length, worked off the body for another single to AB
angled in on the pads, Wiese flicks to fine leg
good length outside off, left alone
slower ball, de Villiers drops back and flicks one fine on the leg side
shuffles across and pushes another single to leg
length ball, defended around off stump
pushed through outside off and chopped past point

flighted, straightening on the stumps and de Villiers takes it on the pad... Rashid likes it but the appeal is turned down by umpire Cloete and England review. This is going to be close but Hawk-Eye has it hitting the top of middle stump on umpire's call, so the decision stands. Marginal but it falls AB's way
tossed up and drilled through the covers
pushes through the legbreak on the stumps, Wiese taps it back
gets on to the front foot and defends
floated up slightly wide, tempting Wiese into another mow, he screws a thick outside edge over point but it lands in an untended part of the outfield
tight lines, defended on the front foot
length ball on off stump, Wiese again blocks respectfully
touch too straight and this is worked through the leg side
shortish, jumps across into line and whips one wide of mid-on
banged in short down the leg side and called wide on height, I think
fullish, in the slot, Wise crumps a drive straight ti mid-off
gets half a stride in and drives into the ground, short extra cover dives across and prevents one, even though he doesn't actually stop the ball
short ball from round the wicket, AB dances out and swipes across the line... huge top edge and it sails over Buttler and away for four
brilliant from de Villiers, skipping out to a full ball and whipping it wide of mid-on for another boundary
on the charge again, this time he hoicks agriculturally over the infield, bounces in front of deep extra cover and comes back to go to 99

back of a length outside off, AB drops back and runs it to third man - that's his hundred, a quite brilliant one in the circumstances. Just a punch of the air for his 24th ODI ton but it's been a match-winner
sliding down the leg side
on the stumps, punched back to the on side
on the pads, flicked through backward square for a couple more
good length on off stump and defended
fired down the leg side - that brings the requirement down to single figures
good length in the channel, de Villiers tries to manhandle it over extra cover... swing and a miss
straighter line and he glances through square leg for one more
sharp bouncer from Woakes, 137kph and it gives Wiese the hurry up as he tries to get on the front foot
short ball, Wiese swivels and hurls a pull through backward square, like a doorman chucking out a drunk at closing time
full and slotted through the covers on the drive, booming shot to finish off the chase - South Africa win by five wickets and take the series 3-2
